summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Interlochen Center for Arts on February 5, 2020. It commands the production of records of all students who attended Interlochen Arts Camp and/or Interlochen Arts Academy from 1994 through 1998, as part of an investigation into alleged violations of federal criminal law, including 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a) (relating to transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity). The subpoena includes a non-disclosure order prohibiting notification of its existence for 180 days.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and non-disclosure order as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands appearance before the Grand Jury at the United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY, at 10 a.m. to testify and give evidence regarding alleged violations of federal criminal law.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena with a non-disclosure order to Interlochen Center for the Arts as part of an official criminal investigation of a suspected felony.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts, 4000 Highway M-137, Interlochen, MI 49643
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, New York, NY
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks records of all students who attended Interlochen Arts Camp and/or Interlochen Arts Academy from January 1, 1994 through December 31, 1998.
The investigation involves alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a), a federal statute related to transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity.
A non-disclosure order prohibits the recipient from notifying any person of the subpoena's existence for 180 days, to prevent impeding the investigation.
The document indicates the investigation was active as of February 2020, led by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The subpoena allows for records to be produced to a Special Agent at the FBI's New York Field Office instead of a personal appearance before the grand jury.
